attributes.action: Ensure the protection of Ashraf residents
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The 36 hostages taken illegally on 28th and 29th July from Ashraf City after 66 days on hunger strike and a further seven on dry hunger strike with some in coma and within hours of death were released and all rushed back to Ashraf City and are now in hospital there.  

 

The on going security of Ashraf is still in doubt until a UN mission is established there. The British government as a member of UN Security Council is required to approve the sending of a UN mission. We petition the Prime Minister therefore to act in such manner as would guarantee the security of Ashraf so that such events as occurred on 28th-29th July 2009 will never again happen and to see that the status of all residents as ‘protected persons’ within the terms of the 4th Geneva Convention is strictly maintained at all times.
